title: 110_s2889
content: The "Veterans Health Care Act of 2008" is referenced in this section, which pertains to specialized residential care and rehabilitation for certain veterans under title 38, United States Code. The Secretary may contract with entities to provide specialized residential care and rehabilitation services to veterans of Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom with traumatic brain injuries and deficits in daily living activities. The Secretary will reimburse full-time board-certified physicians and dentists for continuing education up to $1,000 per year. Hospice care is exempt from copayments, and the policy for voluntary HIV testing is updated. SEC. 6. DISCLOSURE OF MEDICAL RECORDS. Under regulations, the Secretary may disclose the name or address of present or former Armed Forces members to collect charges for non-service-connected disability care. Additionally, medical records can be disclosed to third parties for the same purpose. The Secretary can disclose information to collect charges for non-service-connected disability care under regulations. SEC. 7 amends Section 5317 by removing subsection (g). SEC. 8 increases rates of disability compensation and dependency and indemnity compensation. Effective December 1, 2008, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs will increase dollar amounts for disability compensation and dependency and indemnity compensation as specified in subsection (b). This includes adjustments to compensation, additional compensation for dependents, clothing allowance, new DIC rates, and old DIC rates. The increase in dollar amounts for disability compensation and dependency and indemnity compensation will be based on specific sections of the title, including old DIC rates, additional DIC for surviving spouses with minor children, additional DIC for disability, and DIC for dependent children. The increase will be determined based on the dollar amounts in effect on November 30, 2008, and will be adjusted by the same percentage as benefit amounts under title II of the Social Security Act. The Secretary may adjust disability compensation rates for individuals under Public Law 85-857 in line with increases made under the Social Security Act. Adjusted rates will be published concurrently with specified matters in the Act. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will publish specified amounts in the Federal Register as required by a determination made under the Social Security Act for fiscal year 2009.
